Hadamard factorization

For each z∈Cz \in \Cz∈C, let

F(z)=∑n=0∞(−1)n(z/2)2n(n!)2.F\p{z} = \sum_{n=0}^\infty \p{-1}^n \frac{\p{z/2}^{2n}}{\p{n!}^2}.F(z)=n=0∑∞​(−1)n(n!)2(z/2)2n​.

  1. Show that FFF is an entire function and satisfies ∣F(z)∣≤e∣z∣\abs{F\p{z}} \leq e^{\abs{z}}∣F(z)∣≤e∣z∣.

  2. Show that there is an infinite collection of numbers an∈Ca_n \in \Can​∈C so that

    F(z)=∏n=1∞(1−z2an2)F\p{z} = \prod_{n=1}^\infty \p{1 - \frac{z^2}{a_n^2}}F(z)=n=1∏∞​(1−an2​z2​)

    and the product converges uniformly on compact subsets of C\CC.
Solution.

  1. First, observe that 22n(n!)2≥(2n)!2^{2n}\p{n!}^2 \geq \p{2n}!22n(n!)2≥(2n)!, so

    ∣F(z)∣≤∑n=0∞∣z∣2n22n(n!)2≤∑n=0∞∣z∣2n(2n)!≤∑n=0∞∣z∣nn!=e∣z∣.\abs{F\p{z}} \leq \sum_{n=0}^\infty \frac{\abs{z}^{2n}}{2^{2n}\p{n!}^2} \leq \sum_{n=0}^\infty \frac{\abs{z}^{2n}}{\p{2n}!} \leq \sum_{n=0}^\infty \frac{\abs{z}^n}{n!} = e^{\abs{z}}.∣F(z)∣≤n=0∑∞​22n(n!)2∣z∣2n​≤n=0∑∞​(2n)!∣z∣2n​≤n=0∑∞​n!∣z∣n​=e∣z∣.

    Hence, the sum converges absolutely on compact sets, so FFF is entire.

  2. Notice that FFF is even, so if aaa is a root of FFF, then so is −a-a−a. Also, F(0)=1≠0F\p{0} = 1 \neq 0F(0)=1=0. Since FFF is entire of order at most 111, we have the following Hadamard factorization, where {−an,an}n\set{-a_n, a_n}_n{−an​,an​}n​ are the roots of FFF:

    F(z)=eaz+b∏n=1∞(1−z2an2),F\p{z} = e^{az+b} \prod_{n=1}^\infty \p{1 - \frac{z^2}{a_n^2}},F(z)=eaz+bn=1∏∞​(1−an2​z2​),

    and the product converges locally uniformly. Next, notice that

    F(0)=1  ⟹  eb=1.F\p{0} = 1 \implies e^b = 1.F(0)=1⟹eb=1.

    Since FFF is even, we have

    1=F(z)F(−z)=eaze−az=e2az,1 = \frac{F\p{z}}{F\p{-z}} = \frac{e^{az}}{e^{-az}} = e^{2az},1=F(−z)F(z)​=e−azeaz​=e2az,

    so a=0a = 0a=0. Hence,

    F(z)=∏n=1∞(1−z2an2),F\p{z} = \prod_{n=1}^\infty \p{1 - \frac{z^2}{a_n^2}},F(z)=n=1∏∞​(1−an2​z2​),

    which was what we wanted to show.
